alert.note: Alert for Cecil; Southeast Harford; Southern Baltimore (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 16 at 3:21PM EST until January 18 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Southeast Harford, Southern Baltimore and Cecil Counties. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Monday night, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 4.5 feet, portions of the Havre de Grace Yacht Basin are flooded, along with Hutchins Park. At 3.5 feet, flooding is occurring at the end of Thames Street in Baltimore. Water covers the promenade in the Inner Harbor in multiple locations. At 3.0 feet, water begins encroaching upon yards in the Bowleys Quarters area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides up to 4 feet above normal. The next high tide at Fort McHenry Baltimore is at 6:14 PM and 5:54 AM. The next high tide at Havre de Grace is at 8:59 PM and 9:54 AM. The next high tide at Chesapeake City is at 9:57 PM and 10:14 AM. The next high tide at Port Deposit is at 9:38 PM and 9:18 AM. The next high tide at Charlestown is at 10:06 PM and 9:46 AM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
